{{Infobox Officeholder | honorific-prefix = [[The Right Honourable]] | name = The Earl of Harrowby | honorific-suffix = [[Order of the Garter|KG]] [[Her Majesty's Most Honourable Privy Council|PC]] [[Royal Society|FRS]] | image = Dudley Ryder, 2nd Earl of Harrowby.jpg | imagesize = 200px | caption = | order1 = [[Chancellor of the Duchy of Lancaster]] | term_start1 = 31 March 1855 | term_end1 = 7 December 1855 | monarch1 = [[Victoria of the United Kingdom|Victoria]] | primeminister1 = [[Henry John Temple, 3rd Viscount Palmerston|The Viscount Palmerston]] | predecessor1 = [[Granville Leveson-Gower, 2nd Earl Granville|The Earl Granville]] | successor1 = [[Matthew Talbot Baines]] | order2 = [[Lord Privy Seal]] | term_start2 = 7 December 1855 | term_end2 = 1857 | monarch2 = [[Victoria of the United Kingdom|Victoria]] | primeminister2 = [[Henry John Temple, 3rd Viscount Palmerston|The Viscount Palmerston]] | predecessor2 = [[George Campbell, 8th Duke of Argyll|The Duke of Argyll]] | successor2 = [[Ulick de Burgh, 1st Marquess of Clanricarde|The Marquess of Clanricarde]] | birth_date = {{birth-date|19 May 1798|}} | birth_place = [[London]], [[England]] | death_date = {{death-date|19 November 1882|}} | death_place = [[Sandon Hall]], [[Sandon, Staffordshire]] | nationality = [[British people|British]] | party = | alma_mater = [[Christ Church, Oxford]] | spouse = Lady Frances Stuart
(d. 1859) }} '''Dudley Ryder, 2nd Earl of Harrowby''' [[Order of the Garter|KG]], [[Her Majesty's Most Honourable Privy Council|PC]], [[Royal Society|FRS]] (19 May 1798 – 19 November 1882), styled '''Viscount Sandon''' between 1809 and 1847, was a British politician. He held office under [[Henry John Temple, 3rd Viscount Palmerston|Lord Palmerston]] as [[Chancellor of the Duchy of Lancaster]] in 1855 and as [[Lord Privy Seal]] between 1855 and 1857. ==Background and education== Harrowby was born in [[London]], the son of [[Dudley Ryder, 1st Earl of Harrowby]], and Lady Susan (d. 1838), daughter of [[Granville Leveson-Gower, 1st Marquess of Stafford]]. He was educated at [[Christ Church, Oxford]].[http://www.thepeerage.com/p1097.htm thepeerage.com Dudley Ryder, 2nd Earl of Harrowby] ==Political career== Harrowby was elected [[Member of Parliament]] for [[Tiverton (UK Parliament constituency)|Tiverton]] in 1819, a seat he held until 1831 [http://www.leighrayment.com/commons/Tcommons2.htm leighrayment.com House of Commons: Tipperary South to Tyrone West] before switching to represent [[Liverpool (UK Parliament constituency)|Liverpool]] until 1847.[http://www.leighrayment.com/commons/Lcommons3.htm leighrayment.com House of Commons: Lichfield and Tamworth to London and Westminster South] He served as a [[Lord of the Admiralty]] in 1827{{Citation needed|date=October 2009}} and as [[Secretary to the Board of Control]] under [[Charles Grey, 2nd Earl Grey|Lord Grey]] between 1830 and 1831. He remained out of office for a long time, but in 1855, eight years after he had succeeded his father as Earl of Harrowby, he was appointed [[Chancellor of the Duchy of Lancaster]]{{LondonGazette |issue=21688 |date=3 April 1855 |startpage=1334 }} by [[Henry John Temple, 3rd Viscount Palmerston|Lord Palmerston]], becoming a [[Her Majesty's Most Honourable Privy Council|Privy Counsellor]] at the same time.{{LondonGazette |issue=21688 |date=3 April 1855 |startpage=1324 }} In a few months he was transferred to the office of [[Lord Privy Seal]], a position which he resigned in 1857. He was made a [[Order of the Garter|Knight of the Garter]] in 1859.{{LondonGazette |issue=22281 |date=1 July 1859 |startpage=2549 }} Harrowby was also three times President of the [[Royal Statistical Society]] (1840–1842, 1849–1851, 1855–1857), chairman of the Maynooth commission and a member of other important royal commissions. He was regarded as among the most stalwart and prominent defenders of the [[Church of England]].{{Citation needed|date=October 2009}} ==Family== [[File:Frances Stuart, Viscountess Sandon (d 1859), by Alfred Edward Chalon.jpg|thumb|left|100px|Frances Stuart]] Lord Harrowby married Lady Frances, daughter of [[John Stuart, 1st Marquess of Bute]], in 1823. She died in March 1859. Harrowby remained a widower until his death at [[Sandon Hall]] on 19 November 1882, aged 84. He was succeeded in the earldom by his eldest son, [[Dudley Ryder, 3rd Earl of Harrowby|Dudley]]. ==References== {{reflist}} *{{1911}} == External links == *{{cite DNB|wstitle=Ryder, Dudley (1798-1882)}} * {{Hansard-contribs | viscount-sandon-2 | the Earl of Harrowby }} {{s-start}} {{s-par|uk}} {{succession box | title=[[Member of Parliament]] for [[Tiverton (UK Parliament constituency)|Tiverton]] | with = [[Richard Ryder (19th century politician)|Hon.
